articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Il from Russian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Il from Russian President

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Monday received a message of greeting from D. Medvedev, president of the Russian Federation on the occasion of the day of Korea's liberation.
					
					The message said:
					
					Esteemed Your Excellency Kim Jong Il,
					
					I congratulate you on the occasion of the day of Korea's liberation, national holiday of the Korean people.
					
					We feel thankful to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea for valuing the memory of the Soviet Army soldiers who made great contributions to the cause of liberating Korea from the colonial rule.
					
					History proved the solidity of the friendship between the peoples of our two countries.
					
					We have willingness to boost cooperation with the DPRK in all directions of mutual concern including a three-party plan encompassing Russia, the DPRK and the Republic of Korea in the fields of gasification, energy and railway construction.
					
					They will be of important economic significance and contribute to stabilizing the situation in Northeast Asia and denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Respected Your Excellency Kim Jong Il,
					
					Please accept my best wishes for your good health and success in your work and the Korean people's peace and prosperity.
					
					Respectfully Yours.

articles.title: Greetings to Russian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Russian President

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Monday sent a message of greeting to Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, president of Russia, on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The message said:
					
					On the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation, I extend greetings to you and, through you, the Russian people.
					
					I wish you success in your work, convinced that the relations between the DPRK and the Russian Federation will develop in line with the common interests and desire of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Russian President

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, president of Russia, on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Kim in the message expressed belief that the relations between the DPRK and Russia would develop in spirit of joint documents agreed upon between both sides in the future, too, and wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Liberation Towers and Cemeteries of Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Liberation Towers and Cemeteries of Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower on Monday to mark the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Ambassador Valery E. Sukhinin and staff members of the Russian embassy, members of the Russian Orthodox Church delegation headed by Yegorievsk Archbishop Mark who is chairman of the Committee for Coordinating Overseas Institutions of the church on a visit to the DPRK and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					A wreath in the name of the embassy was placed before the tower.
					
					They observed a moment's silence before looking round the tower.
					
					Then, they laid a wreath and bunches of flowers before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Sadong District, Pyongyang.
					
					Earlier, they placed bunches of flowers before the Liberation Tower and the Monument to Fallen Fighters of the Soviet Army in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, and Wonsan City, Kangwon Province on August 11.
					
					Meanwhile, the consul general and staff members of the Consulate General of the Russian Federation in Chongjin, North Hamgyong Province, laid wreaths before the Liberation Tower and the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Chongjin City on August 13.

articles.title: Reception Given at Russian Consulate General in Chongjin
articles.content:
Reception Given at Russian Consulate General in Chongjin

					Chongjin, August 15 (KCNA) -- The Russian Consulate General in Chongjin, the DPRK, gave a reception on Monday to celebrate the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Invited there were Vice-chairman of the North Hamgyong Provincial People's Committee Kim Ha Jin and officials concerned.
					
					Consul General Vyacheslav Tsupikov and other members of the consulate general were present at the reception.
					
					Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Indonesian Party Leader on Boosting Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Indonesian Party Leader on Boosting Relations with WPK

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Megawati Soekarnoputri, general chairwoman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, congratulated the party, government and people of the DPRK on the achievements made in building an economic power and accomplishing the cause of national reunification under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. She said this when receiving DPRK Ambassador to Indonesia Ri Jong Ryul on August 10 who paid a courtesy call on her. She expressed belief that the Korean people would build a prosperous and powerful country in the near future without fail. 
					
					She noted her party would always support the struggle of the party, government and people of the DPRK for peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula and make positive efforts to boost the relations with the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					She supported the efforts of the DPRK to settle the issue of the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiations, expressing hope that a durable peace-keeping mechanism would be built on the peninsula and Korea be reunified in a peaceful way.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation was marked in Pyongyang on Monday.
					
					Present at the meeting were members of the Council for the Reunification of Tangun's Nation and people from all walks of life in Pyongyang.
					
					A north-south joint appeal was released at the meeting on the anniversary. It recalled Japan which imposed immeasurable sufferings and disasters upon the Korean people in the past is making desperate efforts to enslave Koreans again, while distorting the history of aggression and working hard to grab Tok Islets.
					
					It called upon the national movement organizations in the north and the south to intensify the movements against outside forces and for peace against a war in order to strongly reject the moves of the outside forces for domination, interference and provocation of a war and foil the Japanese militarists' ambition for "reinvasion." 
					
					They will meet all challenges lying in the way of reunification by their concerted efforts under the banner of "By our nation itself" and conduct a dynamic struggle to bring about a turning phase of independent reunification, peace and prosperity, it declared.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Editorially Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Editorially Observed

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Major newspapers of the DPRK Monday dedicate editorials to the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Recalling that President Kim Il Sung accomplished the cause of Korea's liberation, Rodong Sinmun says: It was a historic event as it provided the Korean people with the true right to existence and made it possible for Korea, once eclipsed on the world map, to demonstrate its dignity as a full-fledged independent and sovereign state.
					
					The President in his speech made upon his triumphant return home called on all Koreans to make tangible contributions to building a new country, those with strength dedicating strength, those with knowledge devoting knowledge and those with money giving money. This reflects his far-reaching intention to glorify Korea as an invincible power to be envied by the world by enlisting their inexhaustible strength and creative wisdom. He explored the path of socialism in a unique manner, covering the untrodden road of revolution, and led it to a shining victory. It was thanks to his leadership that the DPRK emerged a socialist power from scratch, setting an epoch-making example in the revolution and construction.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il wrote a heroic epic about patriotic devotion to glorify the DPRK as Kim Il Sung's Korea before the whole world from the very day he started his revolutionary leadership.
					
					The red flag of the Songun revolution held high by Kim Jong Il during the arduous march when the imperialists' vicious moves against socialism and the DPRK reached an extreme phase, in particular, was the banner for accomplishing the cause of perpetuating the memory of the President and a signpost of love for the country, the nation and the people. 
					
					It was thanks to Kim Jong Il's fixed faith and ardent patriotic will that the destinies of the country and the nation were saved once again from the worst adversity, socialist Korea came to demonstrate its might as a political and military power and the country could greet the most shining era of prosperity in the time-honored history of the nation.
					
					Minju Joson calls on all the people to wage a more dynamic struggle to glorify Kim Il Sung's Korea as a Juche-oriented socialist thriving state, a country of happy people, united close around the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of President Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were placed before the statues of President Kim Il Sung on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Servicepersons, people from all walks of life and school youth and children visited the statues of the President standing in various places of the capital including Kim Il Sung University, Kim Il Sung Military University, the Ministry of People's Security and the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace.
					
					Floral baskets in the name of the party, armed forces, power organs, ministries, national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, organsand industrial establishments in the city and schools were laid before the President's statues.
					
					They paid tribute to him, looking back on the feats he performed by accomplishing the historic cause of Korea's liberation and building a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, on this land.
					
					Servicepersons, working people and school youth and children across the country laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before the President's statues standing in their residential areas.

articles.title: Performance of Drama Goes On
articles.content:
Performance of Drama Goes On

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The performance of the drama "We Will Recollect Today" is given before full house in Pyongyang everyday. 
					
					The drama, the winner of the Kim Il Sung Prize, impressively shows the noble spiritual world and staunch fighting spirit of genuine people who live not merely for today but for tomorrow, keeping in mind the truth that victory is always in store for them when they trust and follow leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Officials of ministries, national institutions and organs at different levels in Pyongyang said after watching the drama that the drama serves as a textbook in life as it teaches people how to live and work.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung's Maxim
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung's Maxim

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung in his reminiscences "With the Century" wrote, "Revolutionaries, believe in the people and rely on them at all times and you shall always emerge victorious; if you are forsaken by them, you will always fail. Let this be your maxim in your life and struggle". 
					
					With this maxim, the President successfully waged two decades of the anti-Japanese struggle for national liberation.
					
					In the second half of the 1920s, Korean communists and nationalists were indulged in scramble for hegemony and empty talk, not devoting themselves to the struggle for the country's liberation. 
					
					Under the situation, the President keenly felt that the working people  awakened in a revolutionary way can display great strength and make revolution by themselves under any unfavorable and difficult conditions and that those relying on the people in revolution find nothing impossible. 
					
					With the idea that as fish cannot live without water, so guerrillas cannot live without the people, he made the anti-Japanese guerilla army truly serve the people. 
					
					He always regarded it as a life-or-death issue of the army to love the people and enjoy their support.
					
					Under his great leadership the Korean People's Revolutionary Army successfully accomplished the historic cause of national liberation, based on close relations with the people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Warmongers of Their False Propaganda
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Warmongers of Their False Propaganda

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean warmongers staged such farce as perpetrating a retaliatory shelling, mistaking the blasting in the site for the reclamation of Ryongmae-do Tideland for shelling from the north.
					
					The head of the north side delegation at the north-south military working talks irrefutably probed the truth behind the incident. Yet,  the south Korean military group is busy with the false propaganda aimed to make the story about shelling a fait accompli. It claimed "it was true that explosion was heard" and "it confirmed the places where shells dropped."
					
					Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined-commentary in this regard:
					
					This is a tragicomedy staged by those who are obsessed with hysteria of escalating confrontation plus delusion of persecution.
					
					The shelling touted by the group is a sheer fabrication. This was nothing but the vicious moves of the south Korean military forces to do harm to the DPRK and escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					It does not stand to reason that the group is not able to distinguish blasting from shelling. The above-said reclamation site was very near from Yonpyong Island.
					
					It is the trite method of the south Korean warmongers to spark off a shocking incident to pull the north and kick up a war racket under that pretext. The recent case was little short of the "Cheonan" warship and Yonphyong Island incidents, given that it was far-fetchedly cooked up and a provocation was made under that pretext.
					
					It was not once that the south Korean warmongers staged such poor charade to brand the north as a "provocateur".
					
					Clear is the aim sought by them in making much fuss over the north's shelling "provocation" and the like. It was aimed to chill the desire for detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula and escalate the confrontation at any cost. Such provocation goes to clearly prove who sincerely stands for dialogue and peace on the peninsula and pursues confrontation and war.
					
					They would be well advised to stop such ridiculous burlesque, mindful that they will have to pay a very price for escalating the confrontation with compatriots going against the trend of the times.

articles.title: Resignation of S. Korean Defense Minister Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Resignation of S. Korean Defense Minister Demanded in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- South Korean reunification movement organizations and human rights organizations including the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty held a press conference outside the puppet Defense Ministry on August 12 demanding the resignation of the military boss, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					
					Speakers at the press conference charged that the military tension is escalating due to a string of belligerent remarks made by Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense, and his misdeeds. 
					
					They accused him of inciting the consciousness of confrontation by pursuing a hard-line policy toward the north.
					
					Serious human rights abuses within the army are a product of such moves to escalate the confrontation.
					
					They declared they would launch dynamic actions for the resignation of the defense minister.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists Hit for Burying Koreans Alive
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists Hit for Burying Koreans Alive

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of Victims of Crimes of Japanese Imperialists held a press conference on August 12 at which it condemned them for perpetrating such hair-raising atrocity as  burying Koreans alive in Pusan during their military occupation of Korea, according to south Korean MBC.
					
					Speakers at the press conference recalled in the past the Japanese imperialists buried many Koreans alive after forcing them to build a large torpedo factory in the basements of Pusan Port.
					
					This fact was testified to by bereaved families, they noted.
					
					They urged the authorities to dig up this area to make a thoroughgoing investigation into the atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Demanded in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Students of the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century staged a demonstration outside the puppet National Assembly on August 12 in demand of the settlement of the registration fee issue.
					
					They turned out in their action again because the NA has not taken any step though notices calling for the payment of registration fee for new school term began to be issued, they noted.
					
					They staged the demonstration, chanting slogans "Halve registration fee!"
					
					Enraged at the "Grand National Party" for trying to set in motion the police to suppress the demonstration, far from meeting the demand of the students, the demonstrators waged a stubborn struggle while attempting to enter the NA building.
					
					The fascist police walked off 57 students including Pak Ja Un, chairperson of the Federation.

articles.title: Peace on Korean Peninsula and Independent Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Peace on Korean Peninsula and Independent Reunification Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and public organizations and students in Seoul held a rally on August 11 to achieve the peace on the Korean Peninsula and its independent reunification.
					
					Speakers at the rally said that visits, contacts and cooperation between the south and the north were brisk after the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. But the inter-Korean relations were deteriorated and the danger of war increased on the peninsula after the emergency of the present regime, they added.
					
					They underlined the need to realize peace and stability in the peninsula through dialogue, not through confrontation, and achieve the independent reunification by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation.
					
					They demanded the "government" stop at once all the war moves including the construction of the Jeju naval base.
					
					They urged the authorities to immediately opt for probing the truth about the U.S. forces' crimes related to defoliant burial, getting the U.S. withdrawn from south Korea and settling the registration fee issue.
					
					People from all walks of life will dynamically advance along the road of reunification, holding high the banner of inter-Korean joint declarations, they declared.
					
					Meanwhile, representatives of the Democratic Labor Party, the New Progressive Party and the Party for People's Participation in the Seoul area urged the "government" to roll back the confrontation policy and come out for dialogue with the north.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Feats Praised by Mexican Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Feats Praised by Mexican Personage

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, issued a statement on August 7 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's first start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					He said in the statement Kim Jong Il has brought the national power of the DPRK to the highest level by providing Songun leadership for more than half a century.
					
					The spirit of the Korean People's Army devotedly defending the leader is winning the admiration of the world people, he noted, and added: The single-minded unity of the DPRK has grown as firm as a rock thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					He laid down the line of economic construction in the Songun era and has energetically led the struggle to implement it.
					
					Only victory and glory are always in store for the Workers' Party of Korea and the people advancing under his Songun leadership.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed by Foreign Papers

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan and Russian newspapers carried special write-ups on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud on August 7 carried an article titled "'Long live General Kim Il Sung', the slogan the Koreans shouted at the top of their voices 66 years ago" with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The paper said in the article that the President who brought about the liberation of the country by making long journeys of bloody battles against the Japanese aggressors had wisely led the country and people for nearly half a century after its liberation.
					
					The DPRK has turned into a socialist country centered on the popular masses and a powerful nation, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, it noted, adding that Kim Il Sung was not only the genuine benefactor of the Korean nation's liberation but also the benevolent father of the people and great leader.
					
					No. 8 issue of the Russian newspaper Raboche-Krestsiyanskaya Pravda carried a portrait of the President and an article praising the exploits he performed by accomplishing the cause of the country's liberation and ushering in a new era of the national liberation struggle in colonies.

articles.title: Putin Warns of Ultra-rightist Idea
articles.content:
Putin Warns of Ultra-rightist Idea

					Moscow, August 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin recently called for not allowing ultra-rightist idea to affect society in order to battle extremism.
					
					Speaking to reporters, he said if the country fails to cope with some challenges efficiently in time, extremism appears.
					
					In order to prevent it, it is important not to allow ultra-rightist idea to emerge in society but establish public atmosphere of rejecting it, he added.

articles.title: Russian Official Calls for Public Debate on MD
articles.content:
Russian Official Calls for Public Debate on MD

					Moscow, August 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Permanent Representative to NATO Dmitri Rogozin recently suggested referring the establishment of missile defense (MD) system in Europe to a public debate.
					
					Speaking at the Norwegian Foreign Policy Institute, he said MD expected to be deployed in Europe is viewed as part of a military complex the U.S. wants to bring to the continent.

articles.title: Russia Blasts Israel's Moves to Expand Jewish Settlements
articles.content:
Russia Blasts Israel's Moves to Expand Jewish Settlements

					Moscow, August 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Russian Foreign Ministry on August 12 accused Israel of its moves to expand Jewish settlements.
					
					The Israeli authorities are planning to build new Jewish settlements in east Kuds. In this regard the spokesman branded this as a move to hamstring the efforts of the international community to resume the Palestine-Israel peace talks.
					
					The illegal plan will also further strain the situation in the Mideast, he added.

articles.title: CIS Begins Anti-aircraft Exercises
articles.content:
CIS Begins Anti-aircraft Exercises

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The united anti-aircraft system member nations of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) recently launched joint anti-air raid exercises "Militant Friendship-2011" at two firing ranges of Russia and Kazakhstan. 
					
					The three-stage training draws some 2 000 soldiers, nearly 50 planes and 25 anti-aircraft units from Russia, Kazakhstan, Belarus, Kyrgyzstan, Armenia and Tajikistan.

articles.title: 26th Summer Universiade Opens in Shenzhen, China
articles.content:
26th Summer Universiade Opens in Shenzhen, China

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- The 26th Summer Universiade was opened in Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, China on August 12.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Chinese President Hu Jintao, the president of the International University Sports Federation, heads of state and government of different countries and delegations of 152 countries and regions including the DPRK.
					
					Teams of various countries and regions entered the stadium.
					
					The chairman of the Organizing Committee of the Universiade and the president of the International University Sports Federation spoke at the opening ceremony.
					
					Hu Jintao declared the Universiade open.
					
					Then followed a ceremony of torching the cauldron of the Universiade.
					
					The participants will compete in 306 matches of 24 events including football, volleyball and track and field.

articles.title: China's Cooperation with Different Countries
articles.content:
China's Cooperation with Different Countries

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- China and Sri Lanka on August 11 agreed to boost bilateral cooperation in various fields including economy, trade, culture and infrastructural construction. 
					
					On the same day China and Ukraine agreed to develop military exchange and cooperation.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Refutes West's Media Assertion
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Refutes West's Media Assertion

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Huan Qiu Shibao on August 12 carried an article headlined "China's aircraft carrier will not spark off new arms race".
					
					When Chinese aircraft carrier for research and test was recently launched, some West media insisted the carrier will foster arms race in East Asia in the future, the paper recalled.
					
					Such judgment of the West can be interpreted as an irresponsible instigation and one to put into practice the intention of some people to destabilize the situation in East Asia, it said, and went on:
					
					At a time when Japan and south Korea were developing semi-aircraft carriers several years ago, West's media did not regard them as ones which may threaten the security and stability in East Asia. For what reason do the media regard China's possession of the aircraft carrier for research and test as one affecting regional peace and stability?
					
					This is an unacceptable assessment. Such Cold War-minded way of thinking is affecting the security and stability in East Asia in any aspect.
					
					The U.S. hegemonic moves in the Asia-Pacific region are the main factor of escalating arms race in this region, the paper said, citing concrete facts to prove it.

articles.title: China Calls for Improving Media Activities
articles.content:
China Calls for Improving Media Activities

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- The Chinese media should creditably carry on activities for improving the style of work and writing, said a senior official of the Communist Party of China (CPC) on August 9.
					
					Addressing a video conference Liu Yunshan, director of the Publicity Department of CPC Central Committee, said working among the people and serving them is what makes the CPC always remain invincible.
					
					The media should take a mass viewpoint and implement the mass line, he said. It is important for media to base themselves on the masses and improve their style of work.

articles.title: Chinese Carrier Likely to Be Deployed in South Sea Next Year
articles.content:
Chinese Carrier Likely to Be Deployed in South Sea Next Year

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- Soviet-made Chinese carrier Varyag will be commissioned next year to be deployed in the South Sea of China.
					
					A Hong Kong-based newspaper reported it on August 11.

articles.title: Largest Park Built in China
articles.content:
Largest Park Built in China

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- A park based on the culture of the 8th Route Army was built in Shanxi Province, China.
					
					The 1st National 8th Route Army Cultural and Art Festival will be held soon at the park, the largest in the country, said a news report.

articles.title: Underground Geophysical Observatory under Construction in China
articles.content:
Underground Geophysical Observatory under Construction in China

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- An underground geophysical observatory, the deepest ever in the world, is now under construction in Dunghai County, Jiangsu Province, China.
					
					The soon-to-be-completed observatory, more than 5 000 meters deep, is capable of detecting even an earthquake measuring 1 on the Richter Scale in the fault and its adjacent zone.
					
					Observation equipment have been installed from July 11.

articles.title: China to Build More Kindergartens
articles.content:
China to Build More Kindergartens

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- The Chinese State Council recently released a "2011-2020 program for development of Chinese children" the keynote of which is pre-school education.
					
					The program envisages 70 percent of kindergarten enrollments for those three years before schooling and 95 percent for those one year before schooling. It also calls for increasing public kindergartens in towns and villages.

articles.title: China Launches Pakistan's Satellite
articles.content:
China Launches Pakistan's Satellite

					Beijing, August 14 (KCNA) -- China launched a communications satellite PAKSAT-1R for Pakistan on Friday from the Xichang Satellite Launch Center in southwest China's Sichuan Province.
					
					The satellite was carried by a Long March-3B rocket.

articles.title: Cooperation between Museums
articles.content:
Cooperation between Museums

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- A document on cooperation between the Stalin Museum and Mao Zedong Museum was signed in Gori City, Georgia, on August 11 according to a media report.
					
					The cooperation includes exchange of delegations and exhibition tours on life and activities of Stalin and Mao Zedong.

articles.title: More U.S. Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More U.S. Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- More U.S. soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths due to the offensive operations of the resistance forces of the country.
					
					Five U.S. soldiers were bombed to death in south Afghanistan on Thursday.

articles.title: Jobless Issue Gets Serious in U.S.
articles.content:
Jobless Issue Gets Serious in U.S.

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The jobless issue is still getting serious in the U.S. due to the continued economic depression.
					
					The Labor Department said on August 11 that the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 395 000 in the week ending Aug. 6.

articles.title: Japan Gov't Debt Increases
articles.content:
Japan Gov't Debt Increases

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The outstanding debt of the Japanese government increased to a fresh record high of 943.81 trillion yen ($12.32 trillion) at the end of June. The result represented a 2.1 percent growth from three months earlier.
					
					This was made by the Finance Ministry Wednesday.

articles.title: Iran Exposes West's Corrupt Ideological and Cultural Poisoning
articles.content:
Iran Exposes West's Corrupt Ideological and Cultural Poisoning

					Tehran, August 14 (KCNA) --The Iranian minister of Justice in a talk on August 10 condemned the West's corrupt ideological and cultural poisoning against his country.
					
					The West is scheming to force its view on value on the younger generation of Iran through Internet and satellites, he noted.
					
					He underlined the need to take a retaliatory step to cope with such moves of the West for ideological and cultural poisoning.

articles.title: Palestine Warns U.S. of Its Unreasonable Attempt
articles.content:
Palestine Warns U.S. of Its Unreasonable Attempt

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking member of the Palestine National Liberation Movement (Fatah) in a statement on August 10 warned the U.S. of its unreasonable attempt to challenge the legitimate demands of the Palestinians.
					
					He accused the U.S. of contemplating exercising its veto on a written request for the recognition of the Palestinian independent state to be submitted to the UN General Assembly in coming September.
					
					If the U.S. refuses to recognize the Palestinian independent state, it will face the challenge of the Arabs and the Muslim world and spark off the worldwide criticism, he warned.

articles.title: Buddhist Masses for Reunification Held at Temples across Country
articles.content:
Buddhist Masses for Reunification Held at Temples across Country

					Pyongyang, August 15 (KCNA) -- The "north-south simultaneous Buddhist masses praying for the country's reunification" simultaneously took place at temples across the country on Monday to mark the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Present there were office-bearers of the Central Committee of the Buddhist Federation of Korea and its provincial, city and county committees, priests and monks of temples and believers.
					
					Rituals were made to be followed by speeches and a joint prayer of the north and the south for the country's reunification was read out at the masses.
					
					The speeches and the joint prayer said that the simultaneous Buddhist masses praying for the country's reunification at all temples in the north and the south are significant events as they reflect the desire and will of all the Koreans at home and overseas for reunification.
					
					They called upon all the Buddhists in the north and the south and abroad to intensify the practical actions to resolutely frustrate the reckless moves of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces to provoke a nuclear war against the DPRK, improve the inter-Korean relations and defend and implement the north-south declarations by achieving unity in Dharma-minded concord under the banner of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: UK Police's Brutality Condemned
articles.content:
UK Police's Brutality Condemned

					Tehran, August 14 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on Wednesday strongly condemned the British police for their harsh crackdown on protesters.
					
					Public anger began in the UK when one hundred people gathered outside a police station to protest against the fatal shooting of a young man. 
					
					Speaking to reporters, the President described the harsh crackdown as brutal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de presidente ruso
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de presidente ruso

					Pyongyang, 15 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 15 el presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Dmitri Medvedev, con motivo del dia de la liberacion de Corea.
					
					La misiva senala:
					
					En ocasion del dia de la liberacion de Corea, fiesta nacional, hago llegarle a Vd. mi felicitacion. 
					
					Estamos agradecidos de que la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea guarda preciosamente el recuerdo a los militares del ejercito sovietico que hicieron gran aporte a la causa para liberar a Corea desde la dominacion colonial. 
					
					La historia ha confirmado la solidez de la amistad entre los pueblos de nuestros dos paises. 
					
					Tenemos la voluntad de ampliar la cooperacion con la RPDC en todos los rumbos de interes mutuo incluso el plan tripartito entre Rusia, la RPDC y la Republica de Corea en las ramas de gasificacion, energia y construccion del ferrocarril.
					
					Llevar a efecto tales proyectos revestira suma importancia economica y contribuira a la estabilidad de la situacion del Nordeste Asiatico y a la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Su Excelencia estimado Kim Jong Il, 
					
					Le deseo a Vd. buena salud y exitos en su trabajo, y al pueblo coreano la paz y la prosperidad. 
					
					Con alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Medvedev
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Medvedev

					Pyongyang, 15 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 66o aniversario de la liberacion de Corea, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion al Presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Dmitri Anatolievich Medvedev.
					
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Hago llegarle mi saludo a Vd. y por su conducto al pueblo ruso con motivo del 66o aniversario de la liberacion de Corea.
					
					Estoy convencido de que las relaciones entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses comunes y anhelos de los pueblos de los dos paises y le deseo los exitos en su trabajo.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim dirige construccion de Central Kunmin de Wonsan
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim dirige construccion de Central Kunmin de Wonsan

					Pyongyang, 15 de agosto (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Choe Yong Rim, averiguo el dia 12 en el terreno la obra de construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica Kunmin de Wonsan. 
					
					El premier estudio los problemas que se presentan en la construccion y convoco una reunion consultiva de los funcionarios correspondientes. 
					
					El foro tomo las medidas concretas para asegurar en el maximo nivel la calidad de la construccion y producir y suministrar a tiempo los equipos y materiales de que se encargan las unidades relacionadas.

articles.title: CRPP desmiente rumor de "ciberterrorismo del Norte"
articles.content:
Chinos rechazan la "teoria de amenaza de China" de Japon

					Beijing, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los especialistas chinos rechazaron la "teoria de amenaza de China" escrita en la recien publicada "carta blanca de defensa" de Japon.
					
					Un investigador del Instituto de Relaciones Internacionales Contemporaneas de China senalo que la "amenaza maritima" es el contenido importante de la "teoria de amenaza de China" proferido por Japon en su carta blanca de este ano y revelo que con este rumor, este pais isleno intenta sembrar entre los paises vecinos la conciencia de la "amenaza de China".
					
					El subdirector del Instituto de Asuntos Japoneses de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales de China insistio en que no existe la "coaccion" de China a Japon y EE.UU., especialmente a la alianza entre estos dos paises.
					
					Los especialistas insistieron unanimemente en que Japon no debe divulgar el hecho incorrecto ni suponer impertinentemente el futuro de las relaciones de los dos paises.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia el complot anti-RDPC del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia el complot anti-RDPC del Sur de Corea

					Pyongyang, 15 de agosto (ACNC) -- Hace poco, los belicistas surcoreanos calificaron de una "provocacion" con canonazo la voladura en el campo de roturacion de marismas en la isla Ryongmae de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y abrieron fuego de respuesta.
					
					Aunque el jefe de la parte Norte a las conversaciones militares de trabajo Norte-Sur ha esclarecido la verdad del caso, los compinches de la capa militar surcoreana recurren a la propaganda intrigante diciendo que "se oyeron las detonaciones de canones" y que "han confirmado los puntos de impacto de proyectiles".
					
					Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este lunes y prosigue: 
					
					El presente caso es una farsa infundada y una provocacion anti-RPDC de la capa militar surcoreana para danarla y agravar otra vez la tension de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					No son indistinguibles el estallido de voladura y las detonaciones de canones. 
					
					El campo de roturacion de las marismas de la isla Ryongmae esta cerca de la isla Yonphyong. 
					
					Provocar un incidente sensacional contra la RPDC e intensificar la campana de guerra tomandolo como un pretexto es un metodo rutinario de los titeres surcoreanos. 
					
					En ese sentido, el presente caso es igual a los casos de "Cheonan" y de la isla Yonphyong. 
					
					No es la primera vez que los belicistas surcoreanos urdieron tales complots torpes para acusar a la RPDC de "provocadora". 
					
					Esta vez, lo hicieron con el fin de echar agua fria al ambiente hacia el alivio de la tension y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y agravar de todos modos la situacion conflictiva. 
					
					El hecho comprueba claramente quien desea de veras el dialogo y la paz y quien persigue la confrontacion y la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Los titeres belicistas surcoreanos deben parar las farsas absurdas teniendo presente que pagaran caro por sus maniobras fratricidas que contravienen a la tendencia de la epoca.
